docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 9 Nearly every day, fresh red and white flowers are heaped up before a swastika at the German Cemetery in Buenos Aires.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 9 Nearly every day, fresh red and white flowers are heaped up before a swastika at the German Cemetery in Buenos Aires.
docs.abstract: Article on legend surrounding Ger warship Graf Spee, sunk off Uruguayan coast in '39, which has become focal point for right-wing and even Nazi pol activities in country; speculation on increase of such activities in Ger-Argentine circles

headline.main: Legend of the Graf Spee Serves as a Focus for Rightist Activity in Argentina

docs.snippet: The United States is planning a drastic change in the type of exhibition it will present at this June's Venice Biennale, the oldest and most prestigious of the international art fairs.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is planning a drastic change in the type of exhibition it will present at this June's Venice Biennale, the oldest and most prestigious of the international art fairs.
docs.abstract: US plans drastic change in type of show it will present; expects to present workshop in graphic arts, plus exhibition of some 50-60 contemporary prints; Natl Collection of Fine Arts Internatl Arts Program dir Bingham discusses aims

headline.main: U.S. PLANS SHIFTS IN BIENNALE ROLE; Workshop to Be Highlight at Venice Art Fair

docs.snippet: TRAVEL ABROAD--Most countries recognize the economic advantages of tourism and welcome visitors. However, changing political situations may cause abrupt changes in official attitudes. The information in this chart was obtained from embassies,...
docs.lead_paragraph: TRAVEL ABROAD--Most countries recognize the economic advantages of tourism and welcome visitors. However, changing political situations may cause abrupt changes in official attitudes. The information in this chart was obtained from embassies, consulates, Government tourist offices, United Nations missions and other representatives of the countries, but changes do occur from time to time. Travelers are advised to double check before departing.
docs.abstract: tables on tourist rules and documents

headline.main: TOURIST DOCUMENTS AND REGULATIONS; TOURIST DOCUMENTS AND REGULATIONS

docs.snippet: THE HAGUE, Feb. 24 (Reuters) The International Court of Justice met in special session today for the swearing in of five new judges to bring it up to its full strength of 15.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE, Feb. 24 (Reuters) The International Court of Justice met in special session today for the swearing in of five new judges to bring it up to its full strength of 15.
docs.abstract: Prof Dillard (US), L Ignacio-Pinto (Dahomey), F de Castro (Spain), P D Morozov (USSR) and E Jimenez de Arechaga sworn in as judges; Sir M Zafrulla Khan (Pakistan) is new pres

headline.main: 5 New Judges Sworn By International Court

docs.snippet: LONDON, March 23 South Africa was barred today from this year's Davis Cup tennis competition, but Rhodesia was allowed to play.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, March 23 South Africa was barred today from this year's Davis Cup tennis competition, but Rhodesia was allowed to play.
docs.abstract: S Africa barred from competition by 7-country com of cup nations on grounds its participation would endanger competition through defaults; Rhodesia allowed to compete; ILTF spokesman says opposition to S Africa was due to racial policies, while Rhodesian participation was pol issue; notes Rhodesia has allowed blacks to compete in its tourns

headline.main: South Africa Barred In Davis Cup Tennis; South Africa Is Banned From Davis Cup; Rhodesia Allowed to Play
